Kamatos kamat alatt azt √©rtj√ºk, amikor: Compound interest refers to when not only our initial capital earns interest, but the interest received after our capital also earns interest further.
Ez azt jelenti, hogy a t≈ëk√©nk ut√°n ka: This means that the interest received after our capital is not paid out after a certain period, but is added to our capital, and this amount continues to earn interest.
A h√©tk√∂znapokban sz√°mos fontos p√©nz√: In everyday life, you can encounter the concept of compound interest in many important financial decisions - e.g., when choosing a savings account, taking out a loan, or making investments.
